detailed_description: BAMBOO (Bytedance AI Molecular BOOster) is a machine learning force field framework designed for precise and efficient simulations, with a specific focus on electrolyte systems.

name: FLOWVPM.jl
one_line_profile: Meshless large eddy simulation via reformulated vortex particle method
detailed_description: FLOWVPM.jl is a Julia package for performing meshless large eddy simulations (LES) using the reformulated vortex particle method (VPM), suitable for fluid dynamics research.

name: DL_POLY
one_line_profile: General purpose classical molecular dynamics simulation software
detailed_description: DL_POLY is a general-purpose classical molecular dynamics (MD) simulation software package developed at Daresbury Laboratory. It is designed to support a wide range of molecular systems and force fields.

name: martinize.py
one_line_profile: Tool to create coarse-grained Martini input files for GROMACS
detailed_description: martinize.py is a widely used script/tool for converting atomistic PDB structures into coarse-grained Martini force field topologies and input files suitable for GROMACS simulations.

name: NeuralMD
one_line_profile: Neural network-based molecular dynamics for protein-ligand binding
detailed_description: NeuralMD is a software framework that utilizes neural networks to enhance molecular dynamics simulations, specifically targeting protein-ligand binding processes to improve sampling efficiency and accuracy.

name: ai2-kit
one_line_profile: Toolkit for AI-enhanced ab initio computational chemistry
detailed_description: ai2-kit is a toolkit designed to integrate artificial intelligence with ab initio computational chemistry methods. It provides workflows and tools to accelerate simulations and analysis in materials science.

name: openmmtools
one_line_profile: Batteries-included toolkit for OpenMM molecular simulation
detailed_description: openmmtools is a comprehensive collection of tools and utilities for the OpenMM molecular simulation engine. It includes integrators, test systems, and MCM moves to facilitate advanced MD simulations and method development.

name: perses
one_line_profile: Framework for alchemical free energy calculations and expanded ensembles
detailed_description: Perses is a Python framework for performing alchemical free energy calculations and exploring chemical space using expanded ensemble simulations, built on top of OpenMM.

name: Yank
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated framework for alchemical free energy calculations
detailed_description: YANK is an open, extensible Python framework for performing GPU-accelerated alchemical free energy calculations, particularly for ligand binding, using the OpenMM engine.

name: Streamd
one_line_profile: Fully automated high-throughput molecular dynamics pipeline
detailed_description: Streamd is a Python-based pipeline designed to fully automate high-throughput molecular dynamics simulations, handling system preparation, equilibration, production runs, and analysis.

name: flowerMD
one_line_profile: Flexible library of workflows for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: flowerMD provides a flexible library of organic workflows and extensible recipes for setting up and running molecular dynamics simulations, aiming to simplify complex simulation protocols.

name: CP2K
one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package
detailed_description: CP2K is a quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package that can perform atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid, molecular, and biological systems. It provides a general framework for different modeling methods such as DFT using the mixed Gaussian and plane waves approaches (GPW) and classical molecular dynamics.

name: cp2k-input-tools
one_line_profile: Python tools for validating and generating CP2K input files
detailed_description: A Python library designed to handle CP2K input files with full validation capabilities, including preprocessing features to ensure input correctness for molecular dynamics simulations.

name: cp2k-output-tools
one_line_profile: Python tools for parsing CP2K output files
detailed_description: A collection of Python utilities for parsing and handling output files generated by the CP2K quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package.

name: DBCSR
one_line_profile: Distributed Block Compressed Sparse Row matrix library
detailed_description: A library for sparse matrix operations designed to efficiently handle large-scale electronic structure calculations, serving as a core component for the CP2K simulation package.

name: ufedmm
one_line_profile: Unified Free Energy Dynamics simulations with OpenMM
detailed_description: A Python library that implements Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) for enhanced sampling simulations using the OpenMM molecular dynamics engine.

name: RMD_Digging
one_line_profile: Pre- and post-processing tools for ReaxFF simulations
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based toolkit for reactive molecular dynamics (ReaxFF) simulations, offering functionality for force field parameter formatting, structural statistical analysis, and visualization output.

name: SPLASH
one_line_profile: Interactive visualisation tool for SPH simulations
detailed_description: A visualization and plotting tool designed for Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulations, utilizing kernel interpolation for rendering scientific data.

name: MDSynthesis
one_line_profile: Logistics and persistence engine for MD trajectories
detailed_description: A Python package that provides a framework for managing, storing, and analyzing molecular dynamics simulation data and trajectories, facilitating persistent analysis workflows.

name: DeePMD-GNN
one_line_profile: DeePMD-kit plugin for graph neural network models
detailed_description: A plugin for the DeePMD-kit package that enables the use of various graph neural network (GNN) models for molecular dynamics and potential energy surface representation.

name: DeePMD-kit
one_line_profile: Deep learning package for many-body potential energy representation
detailed_description: A deep learning package designed to generate many-body potential energy representations for molecular dynamics simulations, enabling high-accuracy atomistic modeling.

name: ReacNetGenerator
one_line_profile: Automatic reaction network generator for reactive MD
detailed_description: A tool for automatically extracting and generating reaction networks from reactive molecular dynamics (ReaxFF or ab initio MD) simulation trajectories.

name: Cheetah
one_line_profile: Fast and differentiable particle accelerator optics simulation
detailed_description: A Python library for fast, differentiable simulation of particle accelerator optics, designed to support reinforcement learning and optimization applications in accelerator physics.

name: PhaseForge
one_line_profile: Framework for alloy phase diagram prediction using MLIPs
detailed_description: A framework integrating machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs) with ATAT and CALPHAD modeling to predict alloy phase diagrams, including tools for structure relaxation and TDB generation.

name: pmwd
one_line_profile: Differentiable Cosmological Forward Model
detailed_description: A differentiable cosmological particle-mesh N-body library for forward modeling of structure formation in the universe, enabling gradient-based inference and optimization.

name: pwtools
one_line_profile: Pre- and postprocessing package for atomistic calculations
detailed_description: A Python package for pre- and post-processing of atomistic calculations, supporting multiple codes like Quantum Espresso, CPMD, CP2K, and LAMMPS, with powerful parsers and data structures.

name: EPOCH
one_line_profile: Particle-in-cell code for plasma physics simulations
detailed_description: A multi-dimensional Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed for plasma physics simulations, widely used for studying laser-plasma interactions and high-energy density physics.

name: Grand
one_line_profile: GCMC sampling for water molecules in OpenMM
detailed_description: A Python module that implements Grand Canonical Monte Carlo (GCMC) insertions and deletions of water molecules within OpenMM simulations, facilitating constant chemical potential simulations.

name: Pylians3
one_line_profile: Libraries to analyze numerical simulations (N-body/Hydro) for cosmology
detailed_description: Pylians3 is a set of Python libraries designed to analyze numerical simulations, specifically focusing on cosmological N-body and hydrodynamic simulations (e.g., Quijote simulations). It provides tools for calculating power spectra, correlation functions, and other statistical measures.

name: Quijote-simulations
one_line_profile: Large suite of N-body simulations for cosmological machine learning
detailed_description: The Quijote simulations are a set of 44,100 full N-body simulations designed to quantify the information content of cosmological observables and to train machine learning models. This repository serves as the entry point and documentation for accessing this scientific dataset.

name: Cube-Toolz
one_line_profile: Python tool to manipulate Gaussian cube files
detailed_description: Cube-Toolz is a Python utility for manipulating Gaussian cube files, which are volumetric data files commonly used in computational chemistry to represent electron density or orbitals. It allows for operations like addition, subtraction, and integration of cube data.

name: so3lr
one_line_profile: SO3krates and Universal Pairwise Force Field for Molecular Simulation
detailed_description: so3lr provides an implementation of the SO3krates model and a universal pairwise force field. It is designed for molecular simulations, offering machine learning-based potentials that respect rotational symmetries.

name: LibGeoDecomp
one_line_profile: Library for parallel computer simulations (stencil, N-body, mesh-free)
detailed_description: LibGeoDecomp is a C++ library for developing parallel computer simulations, supporting stencil codes, mesh-free methods, and N-body problems. It handles parallelization details, allowing scaling from smartphones to supercomputers.

name: GSD
one_line_profile: File format and library for HOOMD-blue data
detailed_description: GSD (General Simulation Data) is a file format specification and a Python library for reading and writing GSD files. It is the native file format for HOOMD-blue but is designed to be efficient and generic for storing particle simulation trajectories.

name: HOOMD-blue
one_line_profile: General-purpose particle simulation toolkit optimized for GPUs
detailed_description: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit. It performs Molecular Dynamics (MD) and Monte Carlo (MC) simulations of particles on CPUs and GPUs, designed for high performance and scalability in soft matter research.

name: differentiable-atomistic-potentials
one_line_profile: Automatically differentiable atomistic potentials for molecular simulations
detailed_description: This repository provides implementations of differentiable atomistic potentials, enabling the use of automatic differentiation for tasks like force matching, property optimization, and inverse design in molecular simulations.

name: Grappa
one_line_profile: Machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field
detailed_description: Grappa is a machine-learned molecular mechanics force field designed to improve accuracy over traditional force fields while maintaining computational efficiency. It integrates with GROMACS and OpenMM.

name: GROMACS
one_line_profile: High-performance molecular dynamics package
detailed_description: GROMACS is a versatile package to perform molecular dynamics, i.e. simulate the Newtonian equations of motion for systems with hundreds to millions of particles. It is primarily designed for biochemical molecules like proteins, lipids, and nucleic acids that have a lot of complicated bonded interactions.

name: GASP-python
one_line_profile: Genetic algorithm for structure and phase prediction
detailed_description: GASP (Genetic Algorithm for Structure and Phase prediction) is a Python code that interfaces with energy codes (like GULP, LAMMPS, VASP) to predict crystal structures and phases using genetic algorithms.

name: lammps-logfile
one_line_profile: Python reader for LAMMPS log files
detailed_description: A lightweight Python tool to parse and read log files produced by LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations into simple data structures for analysis.

name: GRO2LAM
one_line_profile: Converter from GROMACS to LAMMPS simulation formats
detailed_description: GRO2LAM is a tool designed to convert molecular dynamics simulation files from GROMACS format to LAMMPS format, facilitating interoperability between these two major simulation engines.

name: GDPy
one_line_profile: Toolkit for generating Deep Potential models with Python
detailed_description: GDPy is a Python package designed to facilitate the generation of Deep Potential (DP) models. It provides tools to interface with VASP for data generation and DeepMD-kit for model training.

name: RASPA2
one_line_profile: Classical molecular simulation code for adsorption and diffusion
detailed_description: RASPA2 is a general-purpose software package for simulating adsorption and diffusion of molecules in flexible nanoporous materials. It uses Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics methods.

name: ScatterNet
one_line_profile: Nanophotonic particle simulation and inverse design using neural networks
detailed_description: ScatterNet provides code for simulating nanophotonic particles and performing inverse design using artificial neural networks. It addresses the forward and inverse scattering problems.

name: unomd
one_line_profile: Automated molecular dynamics simulation of protein-ligand complexes
detailed_description: unomd is a Python package that streamlines the process of running molecular dynamics simulations for protein-ligand complexes. It automates system preparation, parameterization, and simulation execution.

name: ommprotocol
one_line_profile: Command line interface for OpenMM molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: ommprotocol is a command-line application designed to launch and manage molecular dynamics simulations using the OpenMM engine. It simplifies the execution of MD protocols without writing custom Python scripts.

name: gromacs_ff
one_line_profile: Repository of trusted force field files for GROMACS
detailed_description: This repository contains a collection of trusted and validated force field files for use with the GROMACS molecular simulation toolkit, serving as a reference dataset for simulations.

name: PyCGTOOL
one_line_profile: Tool for generating coarse-grained molecular dynamics models from atomistic trajectories
detailed_description: PyCGTOOL aids in the parameterisation of coarse-grained (CG) molecular mechanics models. It processes atomistic trajectories to generate CG topologies and parameters (equilibrium bonds/angles) for use in MD engines like GROMACS.

name: Negative Mass Simulator
one_line_profile: N-body simulation code for exploring negative mass dynamics in cosmology
detailed_description: A Python-based N-body simulation code designed to investigate the dynamics of systems containing negative mass particles, primarily for cosmological research and dark fluid theories.

name: JAX-MD
one_line_profile: Accelerated, differentiable molecular dynamics with JAX
detailed_description: JAX-MD is a framework for performing molecular dynamics simulations that are hardware accelerated (GPU/TPU) and end-to-end differentiable. It enables research into machine learning potentials and optimization of physical parameters.

name: GadgetViewer
one_line_profile: Interactive visualisation tool for Gadget and SWIFT N-body simulations
detailed_description: A lightweight tool written in Fortran/C for visualizing outputs from Gadget and SWIFT cosmological N-body/SPH simulation codes. It supports interactive inspection of particle data.

name: Moltemplate
one_line_profile: Cross-platform text-based molecule builder for LAMMPS
detailed_description: Moltemplate is a general cross-platform tool for preparing simulations of molecules and complex molecular assemblies. It is primarily used to generate input files (data and input scripts) for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics engine.

name: Amaceing Toolkit
one_line_profile: Input generation and post-processing for atomistic simulations (CP2K, MACE, etc.)
detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the creation of input files for various quantum chemistry and machine learning potential codes (CP2K, MACE-torch, SevenNet) and assist in the post-processing of simulation results.

name: Zeno
one_line_profile: Environment for N-body and SPH simulation and analysis
detailed_description: Zeno is a software environment for N-body and Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulations, developed by Joshua Barnes. It includes tools for simulation, analysis, and visualization of astrophysical systems.

name: NRI-MD
one_line_profile: Neural Relational Inference for Molecular Dynamics
detailed_description: An implementation of Neural Relational Inference (NRI) specifically adapted for analyzing molecular dynamics simulations. It infers interaction graphs and dynamics from trajectory data.

name: MCMD
one_line_profile: Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics Simulation Package
detailed_description: MCMD is a C++ software package for performing Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics simulations, supporting various ensembles and potential models.

name: kinisi
one_line_profile: Estimation of diffusion properties from MD simulations
detailed_description: Kinisi is a Python package for analyzing diffusion in molecular dynamics simulations. It uses Bayesian inference to estimate diffusion coefficients and their uncertainties from trajectory data.

name: interfaceff2gro
one_line_profile: Tool to prepare GROMACS input files using INTERFACE forcefield
detailed_description: A script designed to facilitate the use of the INTERFACE force field (for bio-inorganic interfaces) within the GROMACS molecular dynamics engine by converting parameters and generating input files.

name: LAMMPS
one_line_profile: Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator
detailed_description: LAMMPS is a classical molecular dynamics code with a focus on materials modeling. It's an open-source code designed to run efficiently on parallel computers, supporting a wide range of interatomic potentials and boundary conditions.

name: Pizza.py
one_line_profile: Pre- and post-processing toolkit for LAMMPS
detailed_description: Pizza.py is a loosely integrated collection of tools written in Python, designed to provide pre- and post-processing capabilities for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics package, including file conversion and data analysis.

name: OPLSAA-DB
one_line_profile: Database of hand-built OPLS-AA parameters and topologies
detailed_description: A repository containing hand-built OPLS-AA force field parameters and topologies for over 400 molecules, formatted for multiple MD engines including OpenMM, GROMACS, LAMMPS, and NAMD.

name: OpenMM-MD
one_line_profile: General purpose script for running OpenMM simulations
detailed_description: A versatile Python script developed by Lee-Ping Wang for executing molecular dynamics simulations using the OpenMM engine. It simplifies the setup and execution of standard MD protocols.

name: OpenThermo
one_line_profile: Program for calculating molecular thermochemistry properties from QC outputs
detailed_description: OpenThermo is a C++ program that calculates thermodynamic properties (Gibbs free energy, enthalpy, entropy, heat capacity) using statistical mechanics based on output files from quantum chemistry packages like Gaussian, ORCA, VASP, and CP2K.

name: QUIP
one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics framework for GAP and other potentials
detailed_description: QUIP is a molecular dynamics software package that implements various interatomic potentials, most notably the Gaussian Approximation Potential (GAP). It is designed for materials modeling and integrates with LAMMPS.

name: matscipy
one_line_profile: Python library for materials science at the atomic scale
detailed_description: matscipy provides a collection of tools for materials science at the atomic scale, building upon the Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE). It includes efficient implementations of neighbor lists, coordination number analysis, and various utility functions for processing atomic structures and trajectories.

name: PyRAI2MD
one_line_profile: Python Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics
detailed_description: PyRAI2MD is a Python implementation of Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics. It enables non-adiabatic molecular dynamics simulations using machine learning models to predict potential energy surfaces and couplings.

name: asetk
one_line_profile: Toolkit for Atomistic Simulation Environment (ASE)
detailed_description: asetk is a collection of command-line tools and Python utilities based on the Atomistic Simulation Environment (ASE). It provides scripts for structure manipulation, file conversion, and simple analysis tasks in computational materials science.

name: PyAutoFEP
one_line_profile: Automated Free Energy Perturbation workflow for GROMACS
detailed_description: PyAutoFEP is an automated workflow tool for performing Free Energy Perturbation (FEP) calculations using GROMACS. It integrates enhanced sampling methods and automates the setup, execution, and analysis of relative binding free energy calculations.

name: Lumol
one_line_profile: Extensible molecular simulation engine
detailed_description: Lumol is a modern, extensible molecular simulation engine written in Rust. It is designed to be flexible and easy to extend, supporting various potentials, integrators, and simulation methods for molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo simulations.

name: ComplexMixtures.jl
one_line_profile: Analysis of solute-solvent interactions in complex mixtures
detailed_description: ComplexMixtures.jl is a Julia package for analyzing the structure of complex mixtures from molecular dynamics simulations. It focuses on minimum-distance distribution functions (MDDF) to characterize solute-solvent interactions.

name: Packmol
one_line_profile: Initial configuration generator for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: Packmol creates initial configurations for molecular dynamics simulations by packing molecules in defined regions of space. It ensures that atoms do not overlap and respects user-defined constraints, facilitating the setup of complex solvated systems.

name: Deeptime
one_line_profile: Deep learning tools for time-series analysis of molecular dynamics
detailed_description: Deeptime is a Python library for the analysis of time-series data, particularly from molecular dynamics simulations. It implements methods for dimension reduction, clustering, and Markov state modeling (MSM), integrating deep learning approaches like VAMPnets.

name: MPmorph
one_line_profile: Tools for running and analyzing AIMD calculations
detailed_description: MPmorph is a collection of tools developed by the Materials Project to run and analyze ab-initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) calculations, specifically with VASP. It handles workflow management and provides analysis utilities for diffusion and structure evolution.

name: MDTraj
one_line_profile: Library for analysis of molecular dynamics trajectories
detailed_description: MDTraj is a python library that allows users to manipulate molecular dynamics (MD) trajectories. It provides a wide variety of analysis functions, including RMSD, DSSP, and contact maps, and supports many MD trajectory file formats.

name: LightAIMD
one_line_profile: Lightweight ab initio molecular dynamics simulation program
detailed_description: LightAIMD is a lightweight software package for performing ab initio molecular dynamics simulations. It is designed for efficiency and ease of use in simulating material properties at the quantum mechanical level.

name: Timewarp
one_line_profile: Deep learning accelerated molecular dynamics
detailed_description: Timewarp is a research project and tool that uses deep learning to accelerate molecular dynamics simulations. It employs generative models to predict future states of a molecular system, allowing for larger time steps than conventional integration.

name: Two-for-one Diffusion
one_line_profile: Denoising Force Field (DFF) framework for coarse-grained MD
detailed_description: This tool implements Denoising Force Fields (DFF), a method combining diffusion models and force fields for coarse-grained molecular dynamics. It allows for the training of force fields that can simultaneously generate structures and drive dynamics.

name: pair_nequip_allegro
one_line_profile: LAMMPS interface for NequIP and Allegro ML potentials
detailed_description: This repository provides LAMMPS pair styles that enable the use of NequIP and Allegro deep learning interatomic potentials within LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations.

name: PyRAI2MD-hiam
one_line_profile: Variant of PyRAI2MD for ab initio molecular dynamics
detailed_description: This is a variant or development version of the PyRAI2MD software, providing Python-based tools for Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics simulations.

name: Faunus
one_line_profile: Metropolis Monte Carlo simulation framework
detailed_description: Faunus is a framework for Metropolis Monte Carlo simulations of molecular systems. It allows for flexible definition of Hamiltonians, moves, and analysis, suitable for studying equilibrium properties of fluids and soft matter.

name: MISPR
one_line_profile: Materials Science Productivity for Research automation
detailed_description: MISPR (Materials Science Productivity for Research) is a software package for automating materials science computations. It provides workflows for setting up, running, and analyzing DFT and MD simulations, often integrating with FireWorks and pymatgen.

name: Psiflow
one_line_profile: Scalable molecular simulation and ML potential training
detailed_description: Psiflow is a library for scalable molecular simulations, focusing on the automated training and execution of machine learning interatomic potentials. It leverages Parsl for parallel execution.

name: GMSO
one_line_profile: General Molecular Simulation Object for topology management
detailed_description: GMSO (General Molecular Simulation Object) is a Python library for flexible storage and manipulation of chemical topology for molecular simulations. It supports applying force fields and converting between various simulation engine formats.

name: azplugins
one_line_profile: Soft matter simulation plugins for HOOMD-blue
detailed_description: azplugins is a component for HOOMD-blue that adds features for soft matter simulations, including anisotropic particles, special potentials, and integrators not found in the core HOOMD-blue package.

name: gsd-vmd
one_line_profile: VMD plugin for reading HOOMD-blue GSD files
detailed_description: gsd-vmd is a plugin for the Visual Molecular Dynamics (VMD) software that enables it to read and visualize GSD (General Simulation Data) files, which are commonly output by the HOOMD-blue simulation engine.

name: MDANCE
one_line_profile: High-performance clustering for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: MDANCE provides O(N) clustering algorithms for molecular dynamics trajectories. It is optimized for speed and can process large datasets (e.g., millions of frames) efficiently using specialized algorithms.

name: mdapy
one_line_profile: Library for handling molecular dynamics data
detailed_description: mdapy is a Python library designed for the efficient handling and analysis of data generated from molecular dynamics simulations. It provides functions for structure analysis, defect identification, and other post-processing tasks.

name: cp2k-spm-tools
one_line_profile: Tools for simulating Scanning Probe Microscopy (SPM) images using CP2K
detailed_description: A collection of Python tools developed at Empa for post-processing CP2K simulation outputs to generate Scanning Probe Microscopy (STM/AFM) images.

name: NAMD
one_line_profile: Parallel, object-oriented molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation
detailed_description: NAMD is a parallel molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation of large biomolecular systems. This repository mirrors the source code maintained by the National Biomedical Computation Resource (NBCR).

name: Nbody6++GPU
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated N-body code for star cluster simulations
detailed_description: Nbody6++GPU is a high-performance N-body simulation code optimized for GPU acceleration, designed for simulating the dynamical evolution of star clusters and galactic nuclei.

name: OpenAWSEM
one_line_profile: OpenMM implementation of the AWSEM coarse-grained protein folding force field
detailed_description: An implementation of the AWSEM (Associative memory, Water mediated, Structure and Energy Model) coarse-grained protein folding forcefield using the OpenMM simulation toolkit.

name: PySDM
one_line_profile: Pythonic particle-based cloud microphysics package
detailed_description: A Python package for particle-based (super-droplet) warm-rain and aqueous-chemistry cloud microphysics simulations, featuring high-performance backends.

name: OpenFF Evaluator
one_line_profile: Toolkit for physical property evaluation and force field parameterization
detailed_description: A scalable framework for estimating physical properties from molecular simulation data, designed to assist in the parameterization and validation of force fields.

name: OpenFF Interchange
one_line_profile: Interchange object for storing and converting molecular mechanics data
detailed_description: A Python library for storing, manipulating, and converting molecular mechanics data between various software ecosystems (e.g., OpenMM, GROMACS, LAMMPS, AMBER).

name: OpenFF Toolkit
one_line_profile: Toolkit for molecular mechanics parameterization using SMIRNOFF
detailed_description: The Open Force Field Toolkit provides infrastructure for applying SMIRNOFF format force fields to molecules, handling topology, and preparing systems for simulation.

name: OpenMM
one_line_profile: High-performance toolkit for molecular simulation with extensive GPU acceleration
detailed_description: OpenMM is a high-performance toolkit for molecular simulation. It can be used as a library, enabling users to run molecular dynamics simulations on high-performance GPU architectures with extreme flexibility.

name: OpenMM-ML
one_line_profile: High-level API for integrating machine learning models in OpenMM simulations
detailed_description: A high-level API that allows users to easily use machine learning potentials (like ANI, Neural Networks) within OpenMM molecular dynamics simulations.

name: OpenMM-PLUMED
one_line_profile: Plugin interfacing OpenMM with the PLUMED library
detailed_description: A plugin that connects OpenMM with PLUMED, enabling enhanced sampling methods, free energy calculations, and analysis of collective variables during simulations.

name: OpenMM Setup
one_line_profile: Graphical interface for configuring and preparing OpenMM simulations
detailed_description: A web-based application (running locally) that guides users through the process of preparing molecular systems and configuring scripts for OpenMM simulations.

name: OpenMM-TensorFlow
one_line_profile: Plugin for defining forces with TensorFlow models in OpenMM
detailed_description: An OpenMM plugin that allows users to define forces and potential energy functions using neural networks implemented in TensorFlow.

name: OpenMM-Torch
one_line_profile: Plugin for defining forces with PyTorch models in OpenMM
detailed_description: An OpenMM plugin that allows users to define forces and potential energy functions using neural networks implemented in PyTorch.

name: openmmforcefields
one_line_profile: Collection of AMBER and CHARMM force fields for OpenMM
detailed_description: A Python library providing additional AMBER and CHARMM force fields for OpenMM, including support for small molecules via GAFF and other parameters.

name: Atomify
one_line_profile: Real-time high-performance visualizer for LAMMPS simulations
detailed_description: Atomify is a high-performance, real-time visualizer for LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations, capable of streaming and rendering large-scale systems.

name: cg2at
one_line_profile: Tool for converting coarse-grained molecular models to atomistic resolution
detailed_description: A tool to convert coarse-grained molecular dynamics systems (e.g., Martini) back to atomistic resolution, useful for multi-scale modeling workflows.

name: Making It Rain
one_line_profile: Cloud-based workflow for running molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: A collection of Jupyter notebooks that serve as a cloud-based platform/workflow for setting up and running molecular dynamics simulations (GROMACS, OpenMM) on Google Colab.

name: fftool
one_line_profile: Tool to generate force field input files for molecular simulation
detailed_description: A utility to build force field input files (data files) for molecular dynamics simulations (LAMMPS, GROMACS) based on user-provided parameters and molecule definitions.

name: OpenSPH
one_line_profile: SPH and N-body simulation library with GUI for astrophysics
detailed_description: A C++ library and GUI application for Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) and N-body simulations, primarily designed for astrophysical problems like asteroid impacts.

name: Nbody-AI
one_line_profile: Package for N-body simulations and transit timing variation analysis
detailed_description: A Python package for generating N-body simulations and retrieving orbit parameters from transit timing variations (TTV) using Bayesian frameworks and machine learning.

name: VELOCIraptor-STF
one_line_profile: Galaxy/Halo finder for N-body simulations
detailed_description: A structure finder (Structure Finding in 6D) for identifying halos, subhalos, and galaxies in large-scale N-body/hydrodynamical simulations.

name: StellarSolver
one_line_profile: High-performance N-Body simulation library using CUDA and Barnes-Hut algorithm
detailed_description: A high-performance N-Body simulation tool leveraging CUDA for GPU acceleration and the Barnes-Hut algorithm for efficient calculation of gravitational forces in large-scale systems.

name: lammps_interface
one_line_profile: Automatic generation of LAMMPS input files for MOF simulations
detailed_description: A tool designed to automatically generate LAMMPS input files for molecular dynamics simulations of Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs), simplifying the setup process for complex material systems.

name: PICLas
one_line_profile: Parallel three-dimensional PIC-DSMC solver for plasma simulation
detailed_description: A flexible, parallel, three-dimensional particle-based plasma simulation suite that combines Particle-in-Cell (PIC) and Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) methods.

name: Atomsk
one_line_profile: Tool for manipulating and converting atomic data files
detailed_description: A command-line tool for creating, manipulating, and converting atomic data files for various computational materials science codes.

name: pysimm
one_line_profile: Python simulation interface for molecular modeling
detailed_description: A python package designed to facilitate the setup and execution of molecular simulations, providing an interface for building systems and running simulations with various engines.

name: ProtoCaller

detailed_description: A Python library for the full automation of relative protein-ligand binding free energy calculations using GROMACS, streamlining the FEP workflow.

name: cgdms
one_line_profile: Differentiable molecular simulation of proteins with coarse-grained potential
detailed_description: A library for differentiable molecular simulation of proteins using a coarse-grained potential, enabling gradient-based optimization of molecular properties.
